definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
table/desk/classifier for tables of guests at a banquet etc

sentences.english: Eagleburger says the U. S. can try to persuade the North Koreans to come back to the negotiating table.
sentences.chinese: 伊格尔伯格说，美国有能力试图说服北韩重返谈判桌。

sentences.english: Peace can be achieved only around the negotiating table.
sentences.chinese: 和平只可能在谈判桌边达成。

sentences.english: He said Tehran might be ready to return to negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 他说，德黑兰也许已做好重返谈判桌的准备。

sentences.english: Russia opens efforts to get NKorea back into talks.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯展开努力将朝鲜拉回谈判桌。

sentences.english: All life of Zhou Enlai, there are a lot of time is spent in negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来的一生，有许多时间是在谈判桌上度过的。

sentences.english: The members of Club Med no longer need to glower across the table at each other.
sentences.chinese: 联盟成员国不再需要像以前那样在谈判桌上怒目而视。

sentences.english: Mr. Abbas came to the table reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 阿布斯先生勉强地来到了谈判桌上。

sentences.english: Now artificial intelligence software has taken a seat at the negotiating table.
sentences.chinese: 现在人工智能软件被用在了谈判桌前。

sentences.english: The three states will need to swallow their suspicions and return to the table.
sentences.chinese: 三个州必须咽下猜疑，重返谈判桌。

sentences.english: After all, it is the negotiating table, not a game of hardball, that will bring progress.
sentences.chinese: 归根结底还是谈判桌而非政治把戏才会带来进步。

sentences.english: Now they see themselves as sitting at the table.
sentences.chinese: 可如今他们已经坐在国际谈判桌上。

sentences.english: There are too many variables, too many changes on the table and too many competing agendas.
sentences.chinese: 谈判桌上你来我往，竞争和对峙造成了太多变数。

definition: to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
to use force/to come to blows
lit. to exchange weapons of war for gifts of jade and silk (idiom)/fig. to turn hostility into friendship
pinyin: hua4 gan1 ge1 wei2 yu4 bo2
